Name: oid
Description: Row identifier (hidden attribute; must be explicitly\nselected)

Name: relname
Description: Name of the table, index, view, etc.

Name: relnamespace
Description: The OID of the namespace that contains this relation

Name: reltype
Description: The OID of the data type that corresponds to this table's row\ntype, if any (zero for indexes, which have no pg_type entry)

Name: reloftype
Description: For typed tables, the OID of the underlying composite type,\nzero for all other relations

Name: relowner
Description: Owner of the relation

Name: relam
Description: If this is an index, the access method used (B-tree, hash,\netc.)

Name: relfilenode
Description: Name of the on-disk file of this relation; zero means this is a\n"mapped" relation whose disk file name is determined by low-level state

Name: reltablespace
Description: The tablespace in which this relation is stored. If zero, the\ndatabase's default tablespace is implied. (Not meaningful if the relation has no on-disk file.)

Name: relpages
Description: Size of the on-disk representation of this table in pages (of\nsize BLCKSZ). This is only an estimate used by the planner. It is updated by VACUUM, ANALYZE, and a few DDL commands such as CREATE INDEX.

Name: reltuples
Description: Number of rows in the table. This is only an estimate used by\nthe planner. It is updated by VACUUM, ANALYZE, and a few DDL commands such as CREATE INDEX.

Name: relallvisible
Description: Number of pages that are marked all-visible in the table's\nvisibility map. This is only an estimate used by the planner. It is updated by VACUUM, ANALYZE, and a few DDL commands such as CREATE INDEX.

Name: reltoastrelid
Description: OID of the TOAST table associated with this table, 0 if none.\nThe TOAST table stores large attributes "out of line" in a secondary table.

Name: reltoastidxid
Description: For a TOAST table, the OID of its index. 0 if not a TOAST\ntable.

Name: relhasindex
Description: True if this is a table and it has (or recently had) any\nindexes

Name: relisshared
Description: True if this table is shared across all databases in the\ncluster. Only certain system catalogs (such as pg_database) are shared.

Name: relpersistence
Description: p = permanent table, u = unlogged table, t =\ntemporary table

Name: relkind
Description: r = ordinary table, i = index, S = sequence,\nv = view, m = materialized view, c = composite type, t = TOAST table, f = foreign table

Name: relnatts
Description: Number of user columns in the relation (system columns not\ncounted). There must be this many corresponding entries in pg_attribute. See also pg_attribute.attnum.

Name: relchecks
Description: Number of CHECK constraints on the\ntable; see pg_constraint catalog

Name: relhasoids
Description: True if we generate an OID for each row of the relation

Name: relhaspkey
Description: True if the table has (or once had) a primary key

Name: relhasrules
Description: True if table has (or once had) rules; see pg_rewrite catalog

Name: relhastriggers
Description: True if table has (or once had) triggers; see pg_trigger catalog

Name: relhassubclass
Description: True if table has (or once had) any inheritance children

Name: relispopulated
Description: True if relation is populated (this is true for all relations\nother than some materialized views)

Name: relfrozenxid
Description: All transaction IDs before this one have been replaced with a\npermanent ("frozen") transaction ID in this table. This is used to track whether the table needs to be vacuumed in order to prevent transaction ID wraparound or to allow pg_clog to be shrunk. Zero (InvalidTransactionId) if the relation is not a table.

Name: relminmxid
Description: All multixact IDs before this one have been replaced by a\ntransaction ID in this table. This is used to track whether the table needs to be vacuumed in order to prevent multixact ID wraparound or to allow pg_multixact to be shrunk. Zero (InvalidMultiXactId) if the relation is not a table.

Name: relacl
Description: Access privileges; see GRANT and\nREVOKE for details

Name: reloptions
Description: Access-method-specific options, as "keyword=value" strings
